Male Pt presents with Mom for Initial Orthodontic Consultation Note: baseball, catcher On time: on time Covering Faculty: [DOCTOR] Chief Concern: " not so much concerned about esthetics, more about health and fxn of teeth " RMHx: No contraindications to today's consultation. Significant Findings: LL3, UL2 x-bite. Gen. mod U/L spacing. LL#E still present. RDHx: healthy EOE: wnl IOE: wnl R Molar Classification: 1 L Molar Classification: 1 TMJ: ( No ) Crepitus, ( No ) , No Clicking of TMJ, Pain on Palpation, ( No ) Hx of Trauma Recommendations: Yes Records to be taken, CBCT ( Full + Report ) , IO and EO photographs, Scan/Models of Maxillary and Mandibular Arches. retroclined UAs, min. OJ, OB. May have class III tendency. NV: Consultation of Tx Options, Begin Tx upon approval

Male presents for consulation and bonding of U/L arches CC: want better bite, close spacing. . RMHx: Pt denies any changes Significant Findings: mod. gen. U/L spacing. Min OJ/OB. RDHx: pt denies any changes No contraindications to today's tx Has pt had cleaning since last visit? Unanswered Tx: Discussed at length all RBA to treatment, discussed all findings on Radiographic Report, Presented Powerpoint Informed Consent, pt expressed understanding, had all questions answered, and would like to begin tx. All contracts and consents have been reviewed and signed by all parties. Covering Faculty: [DOCTOR] Appliance System: Victory MBT .022 Upper Wire: .014 sentalloy Lower Wire: none Mechanics Note: Bonded U6-6, took progress pics today NV: Bond L6-6 Victory MBT .022

Male presents for consulation and bonding of U/L arches CC: want better bite, close gen. spaces . RMHx: Pt denies any changes Significant Findings: mod. gen. U/L spacing, min. OJ/OB. RDHx: pt denies any changes No contraindications to today's tx Has pt had cleaning since last visit? Unanswered Tx: Discussed at length all RBA to treatment, discussed all findings on Radiographic Report, Presented Powerpoint Informed Consent, pt expressed understanding, had all questions answered, and would like to begin tx. All contracts and consents have been reviewed and signed by all parties. Covering Faculty: [DOCTOR] Appliance System: Victory MBT .022 Upper Wire: * Lower Wire: .014 sentalloy Mechanics Note: Bonded L6-6. U7 turbos to prevent shearing off lower brackets. **L4 brackets will need to be repoed in the future. Placed too occlusal compared to L6s,5s. NV: wire adjustment, RDA will take progress photos

{"extraction": {"Lower Bonding": true, "Prescription and Bracket Slot": "MBT conventional 0.022\"", "Changed Lower Arch Wire": true, "Lower Wire Material": "Other", "Lower Wire Size": "0.014\"", "Posterior Bite Turbos": true}}
You are an expert Orthodontist Assistant. Extract the positive findings from the clinical note as JSON.

NV: bond 7s, repo L4s more ging., reduce turbos, get 16x22 sentalloy and engage 7s. Will recip. close gen. spaces once we get into 19x25 SS AW. Large rect. wire will allow more translation of teeth into spaces and more torque control of teeth as we close spaces. This will prevent lingual dumping of U/L ant. teeth crowns. We want to maintain incisor inclinations.

{"extraction": {"Changed Upper Arch Wire": true, "Changed Lower Arch Wire": true, "Upper Wire Material": "Other", "Upper Wire Size": "0.016\"x0.022\"", "Lower Wire Material": "Other", "Lower Wire Size": "0.016\"x0.022\"", "Bracket OR BAND Repositioning": true}}
You are an expert Orthodontist Assistant. Extract the positive findings from the clinical note as JSON.

NV: retie 2.19x25 niti 3. Pan, repo once we have closed some spaces once we're in SS 19x25 wire. (We want to maintain the upper incisor position and not retract them. We can do this by using class III elastics and PC at the same time to close generalized upper spacing (AP forces cancel out and only post. teeth will be brought forward to close the generalized spacing).

Pt presented with broken retainer. Retainer was broken where the left labial bow meets the acrylic. Told patient that he will have to pay for new retainer as it has been a year and the retainer can not be repaired... it has to be remade. Instructed patient that he has to remove retainer with his finger and not continue to play with his tongue Pt says mom will call for appt when she can come back in to pay for new retainer and to do scan.
